intro: Antidesma blumei, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically consumed fresh or used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it an important species in its native habitat.
